required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Ambu Auragain and I-Gel Supraglottic Airways in Adult Patients at an Ambulatory Surgery Center
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Ambu Auragain and I-Gel Supraglottic Airways in Adult Patients at an Ambulatory Surgery Center

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine if an I-gel laryngeal mask airway (LMA) has a higher oropharyngeal leak pressure compared to an Ambu Auragain in adult patients in an ambulatory surgery center.

detailed_description.textblock: Patients who are scheduled for elective ambulatory surgery under general anesthesia will be randomized to one of two groups. Group 1 will receive an I-gel laryngeal mask airway (LMA) and group 2 will receive an Ambu Auragain LMA.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Patients who are scheduled for elective ambulatory surgery under general anesthesia will be randomized to one of two groups. Group 1 will receive an I-gel laryngeal mask airway (LMA) and group 2 will receive an Ambu Auragain LMA.

primary_outcome.description: OLP will be measured immediately after insertion. This will be accomplished by closing the expiratory valve while keeping fresh gas flow at 3 liters/minute until equilibrium is reached. Pressure will be reported in cmH2O.

secondary_outcome.description: Time required to place laryngeal mask airway will be measured and reported in seconds.
Number of attempts required for successful insertion of laryngeal mask airway.
Percent of laryngeal mask airway placements that are successful upon first attempt.

The clinician who places the laryngeal mask airway will be asked to rate ease of insertion on a four point rating scale: 1, no resistance; 2, mild resistance; 3, moderate resistance; and 4, inability to place device. Outcome will be reported as the mean score per group.
Number of adjustments made to laryngeal mask airway following insertion.

Participants will be asked upon discharge from recovery room (approximately 8 hours post surgery) to rate the soreness of their throat on a numerical rating scale of 0-10 (0 being no soreness and 10 being maximum imaginable soreness). Participants will be asked to rate throat soreness again via phone call approximately 24 hours after surgery.

secondary_outcome.measure: Blood staining of Laryngeal Mask Airway
secondary_outcome.description: Upon removal, staff will observe the laryngeal mask airway for the presence of blood and report a yes or no value. Number of devices with blood staining will be reported per group.

arm_group.description: Group 1 will receive the I-Gel Laryngeal Mask Airway for airway maintenance during general anesthesia
Group 2 will receive the Ambu Auragain Laryngeal Mask Airway for airway maintenance during general anesthesia

intervention.description: The I-Gel Laryngeal Mask Airway is a medical device that keeps a patient's airway open during anaesthesia or unconsciousness.
The Ambu Auragain Laryngeal Mask Airway is a medical device that keeps a patient's airway open during anaesthesia or unconsciousness.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- undergoing outpatient ambulatory surgery under general anesthesia that is amenable to using a laryngeal mask airway
Exclusion Criteria:
- non-English speaking patients
- patients with abnormal airway anatomy
